humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, one out of ten assessed lymph nodes is positive for metastasis (Axillary 1/10). Based on the new rules provided, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that 1 out of 10 axillary lymph nodes are positive for metastasis (Axillary 1/10). This corresponds to a pathologic N1 stage, as defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). The N stage is determined by the number of lymph nodes involved, and in this case, a single positive lymph node falls under N1. The absence of extracapsular invasion or substaging information does not affect the N1 classification.
